title: Matthew Maslow
text:
I’m a data scientist with a strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and cloud-based analytics. I earned a B.S. in Data Science from St. Lawrence University in May 2024, where I focused on applied statistics, advanced modeling, and database systems. I have recently completed my M.S. in Data Science at Boston University, with coursework in Bayesian statistics, machine/deep learning, AI ethics & Privacy, medical science, financial analytics, and Big Data with Azure.
My work spans health analytics, finance, sports, and public survey data. Highlights include:

Building real-time Azure pipelines and sentiment models for cryptocurrency analytics

Creating Shiny dashboards and Power BI visualizations for public health and sports data

Developing predictive models for depression risk using the NHANES survey and clinical data

Contributing to a published clinical research article on hemodynamic monitoring in cardiac patients

Whether regression modeling, cloud infrastructure, or storytelling through dashboards, I love applying data to solve real-world problems with clarity and insight.

title: Matt Maslow
text:
US Alcohol Consumption Dashboard
Interactive Shiny app visualizing historical trends in per capita alcohol consumption across U.S. states by beverage type.
March Madness Analysis
A Shiny dashboard analyzing NCAA March Madness performance, team statistics, and tournament insights.
Bitcoin Market & Sentiment Tracker
Real-time Power BI dashboard combining social sentiment analysis and cryptocurrency price signals, powered by Azure-based data pipelines.

title: Matt Maslow
text:
As a Research Assistant (Summer 2023), I conducted statistical analysis in RStudio — including descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing — to examine systolic pressure variations across three arterial sites in cardiac surgery patients. This work contributed to a peer-reviewed research article published in the Journal of Cardiothoracic and Vascular Anesthesia.
Citation:
Bui D, Hayward G, Chen TH, Apruzzese P, Asher S, Maslow M, Gorgone M, Hunter C, Flaherty D, Kendall M, Maslow A. Hemodynamic Monitoring in The Cardiac Surgical Patient: Comparison of Three Arterial Catheters. J Cardiothorac Vasc Anesth. 2024 May;38(5):1115–1126. doi: 10.1053/j.jvca.2024.02.010. PMID: 38461034.
View article



During my Senior Year Experience (SYE) at St. Lawrence University, I developed a public-facing data analytics project published by the SCORE Network. The project analyzes rider and bull performance data from the Professional Bull Riders (PBR) tour, using scraped statistics and custom indicators to explore event structure, athlete outcomes, as well as creating educational material for new data science learners to use.
View SCORE Network Project

title: Projects
text:
Bitcoin Market & Sentiment Tracker
Power BI dashboard analyzing cryptocurrency market sentiment and price signals using social media and historical price data.
View Dashboard
GitHub Repo



US Alcohol Consumption Dashboard
Shiny app visualizing historical trends in per capita alcohol consumption across U.S. states by beverage type.
Launch App
GitHub Repo



2024 March Madness Analysis
Shiny dashboard analyzing 2024 NCAA March Madness performance, team statistics, and tournament insights. Launch App GitHub Repo



Financial Analytics: CEO Pay and Performance
Regression-based group study examining the relationship between executive compensation and financial performance in tech companies.
GitHub Repo



Hemodynamic Monitoring (Clinical Research)
Statistical R analysis on arterial pressure site comparisons in cardiac surgery patients. Used in peer-reviewed publication.
GitHub Repo



Music Genre Classification Using Deep Learning
KNN vs. CNN comparison using audio features and spectrograms to classify music genres.
GitHub Repo



Predicting Depression Risk from NHANES Data
Logistic regression and XGBoost models with SHAP explainability and class rebalancing (SMOTE).
GitHub Repo



SYE – SCORE Network (Rodeo Sports Analytics)
Capstone project analyzing PBR bull rider performance. Published to the SCORE Network.
GitHub Repo



Tree-Based Beta Regression for Metatranscriptomics
Group project, where we modeled microbial gene expression data using beta regression and tree-based feature selection.
GitHub Repo



Save the Children: Attendance & Retention Analysis
Group Project, where we used ML modeling and pipeline work for student data across multiple countries (I specifically worked on Student Retention Studies).
GitHub Repo

title: Contact
text:
I’m always open to connecting about new projects, roles, research, or collaborations — especially in applied data science, analytics, or data engineering. If you have a question or just want to say hi, feel free to reach out!




Email (Personal): mjmaslow13@gmail.com

title: Resume / CV
text:
You can download my most recent resume below:

Download Resume (PDF)




I am a data scientist with experience in data processing, analytics, modeling, engineering, and implementation — including interactive dashboards. I hold a B.S. in Data Science from St. Lawrence University and recently completed my M.S. in Data Science at Boston University, where I focused on machine/deep learning, AI ethics & privacy, medical science, financial analytics, and big data engineering with Azure.
I bring hands-on experience developing machine learning pipelines, performing clinical research, and building data products in collaboration with health institutions, nonprofits, and academic teams. I’m especially passionate about applying technical rigor to high-impact, real-world domains.





Languages & Libraries: Python, R, SQL, Excel, scikit-learn, XGBoost, SHAP

Tools & Platforms: Jupyter, RStudio, Power BI, Microsoft Azure, Git, MySQL, APIs

Modeling Techniques: Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Beta Regression, Gibbs Sampling

Specialties: ETL Pipelines, Health Data, Sentiment Analysis, Educational Analytics

Certifications: CITI Program, HIPAA Compliance

title: Publications
text:
Hemodynamic Monitoring in Cardiac Surgery
As a Research Assistant at Brown University Health, I contributed to a clinical study analyzing arterial pressure sites in cardiac surgery patients. I conducted statistical testing in R — including descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing — which supported the final peer-reviewed publication.
Journal of Cardiothoracic and Vascular Anesthesia, May 2024
Citation:
Bui D, Hayward G, Chen TH, Apruzzese P, Asher S, Maslow M, Gorgone M, Hunter C, Flaherty D, Kendall M, Maslow A. Hemodynamic Monitoring In The Cardiac Surgical Patient: Comparison of Three Arterial Catheters. J Cardiothorac Vasc Anesth. 2024 May;38(5):1115–1126. doi: 10.1053/j.jvca.2024.02.010. Epub 2024 Feb 13. PMID: 38461034
GitHub Repo



Rodeo Sports Analytics – SCORE Network Publication
For my Senior Year Experience (SYE) at St. Lawrence University, I developed a data science project analyzing bull rider performance in the Professional Bull Riders (PBR) tour. I created cleaned datasets, custom indicators, and educational material, and the project was officially published by the SCORE Network as an open-access data product.
View SCORE Network Publication
GitHub Repo
